website_summaries.verdict: This two-sided target uses friction rather than force to stop your arrows.
pros: Patented open layer design stops arrows with friction not force, allowing for easy removal
High contrast white-on-black aiming points offer great visibility and measurement of accuracy.Comes with handle for easy transport
cons: If you have trouble removing arrows, wait until they cool down from friction, then try again

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Target for Field Tips and Fixed/Mechanical Broadheads!
customer_reviews.text: If you are worried about the cost of the product, I'll explain why this is a good purchase over time. I've been shooting blocks for several years now and I've never had any problems with them. This target is super durable when it comes to shooting field points. I've been shooting mechanical (Rage) and fixed (Muzzy) broadheads into this target for a few weeks now and it is holding up fine. There is some cosmetic damage from the mechanical and fixed broadhead practice, but that is to be expected. Don't sacrifice quality for price, you won't regret buying this target.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Still a great target, just know it won’t last like the ...
customer_reviews.text: This target in a little weaker than the first one I bought in 2004 that has had thousands of arrows, both field tip and Brodheads shot into it and just recently started to penetrate to the fletching, but this new one with only a couple of hundred field tips shot into it, has started to penetrate almost to the fletching. I don’t see this one lasting 12 years. I guess they needed to make it a little less durable to increase the frequency of purchases. Still a great target, just know it won’t last like the old ones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Trash in less than five days of shooting.
customer_reviews.text: Field tips and Broadhead blow through this junk target. My bow is shooting 270fps, not exactly fast. Arrows blowing through to the fletching even at 50 yards. I’d avoid this target if at all possible. Spend more money and hopefully get something worth a darn.
customer_reviews.author: GMcD

customer_reviews.title: about as good as you can find for the money
customer_reviews.text: we back stop it to bales of hay or straw, we use broadheads, and yes they will chew out after a season or so and yes you will will have to move around the target, and it takes crossbows ranging from 345 fps to 380 fps.........but with our fixed blades you do have to take the heads off or push is straight through.............since we use tuning washers that isn't much of an ordeal.......I would rather use the layers than pure foam because that is even worse to get out.
customer_reviews.author: Linda L Sikkenga

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Target
customer_reviews.text: I debated on whether to buy a Morrell Yellow Jacket or a Block Classic. After researching and reading tons of reviews, I purchased a Yellow Jacket. What a mistake! I returned the Yellow Jacket and instantly purchased a Block Classic. I've shot over 500 arrows in this thing, left it out through many rain storms, even used it is a camp fire seat, and this target still looks new. This target stops arrows effortlessly and makes pulling arrows out a breeze. I recommend the Block Classic for anyone who is looking to be motivated to shoot their bow, not dread it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your time or money
customer_reviews.text: I have owned probably a dozen different foam targets over the years, and this one is by far the worst target I’ve ever owned. Even brand new straight out of the box, my 70lb Mathews traverse (with a 500g arrow) sunk the arrows all the way up to the fletching with field points, and broad heads completely passed through. I added another foam target behind the target, and continued using it, and it was completely shot out in about a month. Probably only a couple hundred arrows, with a 50/50 mix of fixed blade broad heads and field points. I would highly recommend spending a little extra and getting something quality, especially if you’re using a fast shooting bow.
customer_reviews.author: James Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Delighted
customer_reviews.text: This Block Classic 22 has been an excellent target for me. So far, I have shot over 5,000 arrows (field points only) through it and it's still going strong. The foam is getting thin in some areas, but so far only the tips of arrows are poking through the back and only on occasion. It's hard to know for sure, but I'm guessing there's another 3,000 shots to be had before it'll need to be retired. Arrows are easy to remove and paper targets stay pinned in place very nicely - which is not true of other bag/block targets.
customer_reviews.author: David Ruben

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I will start with the negative. For what this is, it is priced too high. That's on the manufacturer, not Amazon. I have shot a few hundred arrows into this thing, and a handful of them around it... lol. It has stopped every arrow at about a 4-6" depth without any issue. I shoot on a 75lb draw, and it holds up at all distances. The dots are easy to see, and the arrows come out as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Tank

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t stop anything.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t stop field tips or broadheads from a compound; clean pass through at 20. Broadheads also shred the target, black foam strips everywhere. Crossbow bolts pass clean through at 40 yards. Purchased to avoid shredding a heavy bag target, but now I am using the bag target behind this one to hold it in place (this one is light) and catch the arrows that pass through. So bag target is still getting shredded. Very decent field tip target out at 40+ yards.
customer_reviews.author: M. Folch

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I was led to believe
customer_reviews.text: The target started off great , me and my son both shoot Bear bows @65lbs 30in draw and maximum red arrows by the 20th shot from 30yds we were getting complete pass through of the target , not only does it suck looking for arrows but it ruins the fletchings
customer_reviews.author: John Murphy Sr

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: Shot about 60 arrows into this so far, half from a #40 recurve and the other half from a #50 compound. Overall the target is holding up great. Stops the arrows, and it's not hard to remove the arrows from the block. I got the 18" block and it's a little smaller than the description claims (description is 18" wide and 14" deep, mine is 17.5" wide and 13" deep) - but it's still plenty to stop the arrows that I'm shooting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Crossbow Target
customer_reviews.text: I've had this target for 8 months and after 1,000 22" 650 grain bolts at 380 fps, it's still performing well, I'm shooting GT Nitro w/ 70 grain FACT and 150 grain Excalibur field points at 60 yards (I hunt w/ Schwack 3" 150 grain)- I don't see this well made target having any problems for 2-3 years (do use Scorpion Release treatment) it's much easier to remove the bolts
customer_reviews.author: Daniel SmithTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Even better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I got this target after my Yellow Jacket field bag target got worn out and it's more than adequate as a replacement. Very light and easy to move around, but super sturdy too. Field point arrows go about 1/3 of the way in and are fairly easy to remove. Nothing bounces off unlike the bag target. Should be able to take a lot of hits for a long time to come.
customer_reviews.author: AnneS

customer_reviews.title: Stops some arrows!
customer_reviews.text: So it wasn’t exactly like the pic but that’s fine it stops arrows well. After only three months outside the wrapping is coming off. That’s fine I guess, I duct taped it and it looks a little ghetto, but it does stop arrows really well. I’d bring it into the garage if your not shooting allot. The wrapping will live longer.
customer_reviews.author: David Cain

customer_reviews.title: Product arrived damaged
customer_reviews.text: I have used these targets for years. The layered design is great for stopping arrows. This is the first one that I have purchased and it arrived with a large slice thru the corner of the protective side wrap. I was careful not damage it when opening. It appears that it was damaged by Field Logic. I don't know how this will effect the life of the target. I should have purchased from my local shop. I know these are great targets and would buy again. However, I will not recommend buying from this Field Logic (FeraDyne Outdoors).
customer_reviews.author: Russ Billings

customer_reviews.title: But the 20inch (top).Very little size difference than 22inch (bottom)
customer_reviews.text: Little use, but great so far. Broadheads, a bit tougher than field points. Minimal difference from 20 inch to 22 inch. $79 vs $99. Savev yourself 20 bucks and go with the 20 inch version.
customer_reviews.author: CNJ Guy

customer_reviews.title: Favorite!
customer_reviews.text: My favorite target ever! I do wish the dots were harder to see but I use orange duct tape
customer_reviews.author: Chancefam

customer_reviews.title: No Fun with This One!
customer_reviews.text: Need to re-clean your arrows after every shot as the foam sticks to arrow upon entry. Both broadheads and target tips travel through the target and up to the fletching. Necessary to remove the broadhead tips on the exit side and grip and pull with all your might to remove the arrow shaft! Very challenging target and not user friendly at all.
customer_reviews.author: MAK

customer_reviews.title: Thunk!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd or 3rd one I've owned. I would say I get about 1000-3000 shots at each one before it starts coming apart. That's about a year of shooting for me and my buddies. We even leave it outside in the Arizona sun and it holds up well. Practice tips and broadheads from a 60 lb bow.
customer_reviews.author: Topher

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money on this target!
customer_reviews.text: This target ruined every crossbow bolt shot at it as they all penetrated to the fletching. Horrible stopping resistance and very difficult to remove the bolts. Do not waste your money on this target!
customer_reviews.author: Shane & Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Works ok!
customer_reviews.text: I have 400fps target or field point only so bought this mainly by reading reviews on broadhead targets. It stops my 305 fps bolts 2inches before quills at 30 yds.Come out fairly easy but big pieces of block came out with bolts. Tried field tip took 2men to remove bolts!It Does what says and for price is OK for checking sight in with hunting broadheads not everyday practice.
customer_reviews.author: Gissa1

customer_reviews.title: Good for Field Points
customer_reviews.text: Does what you want for field points, very portable. My only issue and its kind of suspected was the broadheads really tear this product up. After less than 50 broadhead shots the center is completely blown out. So I can no longer shoot the center of this target, I also no longer shoot broadheads at this. Buy for field points and you'll love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good target
customer_reviews.text: This is my first block target and I am pleased with how well it stops the arrow and the ease of pulling them out. But when you use broadheads I was slightly surprised on how fast it chewed up the foam.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Pratice Target
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this to archery target for a couple months now. I've probably shot about 200 arrows into it and there is no real deterioration to the performance of this target. I expect this target will last me 2 or 3 archery seasons with no problems. Even though it says this will work with broadheads I would advise against it since it will destroy the individual layers much quicker than a field point. Pros: Great Durability Easy arrow pull (MUCH MUCH easier than my foam deer target) Cons: Wish there were 5 white dots rather than the block classic writing in the lower left corner
customer_reviews.author: Prime Time

customer_reviews.title: An industry favorite
customer_reviews.text: When the Block target came onto the scene, they were widely touted as the best all around target out there. Not much has changed. Love the size and portability, but the arrow stopping is why I love Block target so much. Broadheads or field points - same arrowing stopping performance.
customer_reviews.author: Tom in Olympia, WA

customer_reviews.title: Works good. Bought for fixed blade broadheads
customer_reviews.text: Works good. Bought for fixed blade broadheads. It works as it should. I don't shoot less than 30 yards when I'm practicing so I can't say whether it would stop an arrow shooting at 20 yards or less. At 30 they usually stop before hitting my vanes.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Archery
customer_reviews.text: Christmas present for my son. He hasn't used it yet but was excited to receive it. I was a bit disappointed that the sides were all torn up and a shipping label was attached to the top so that it wasn't removable without tearing it more.
customer_reviews.author: Book Lover

customer_reviews.title: absolutely awesome
customer_reviews.text: I just got into archery so when I saw little squares to shoot at costing so much i was baffled. but i have to admit totally worth it, this thing is amazing, perfectly saves the arrows and doesnt even look like its been shot at. very satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: Great Target
customer_reviews.text: I shot a ton of arrows in this the first day I got it... 50lb Recurve. Looked like new after I was finished. Great Target!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Block
customer_reviews.text: Solid and well built. It has a good weight and it’s very well balanced so if you hit it on the edge it won’t tip over
customer_reviews.author: Happy Boy

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE LOVE LOVE this product
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE LOVE LOVE this product! i use it for throwing knives and archery and it holds up better than anything Ive used to date. Will keep purchasing as I keep destroying them! (they get destroyed with time but I've had at least 1000 throws and arrows and the three I've ordered are still in good enough shape to take at least another 3-4,000 a piece. Love em once again.
customer_reviews.author: Ashkii

customer_reviews.title: Lighter, smaller, and tougher! Great.
customer_reviews.text: I had an older block target which lasted me about 4-5 years until the middle white circle was completely gone and my arrows could pass through it from shooting it so much. I bought this guy and compared it to my old one. I saw that it was lighter, smaller and felt like it was more compact and tougher material. Overall a great target for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Byron Bruno

customer_reviews.title: Great block. Stops my arrows (324 fps)
customer_reviews.text: This product is definitely a step up from most standard blocks you get from the big box stores. Seems much firmer of grip, but beware, when you get close to hunting season and start using broad heads just to test flight, it will grab them and possibly bend the mechanical arms on the newer broad heads. I suggest getting a brand of broad head that utilizes practice tips for target shooting.
customer_reviews.author: Savvy

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it! Look elsewhere!
customer_reviews.text: Barely used this with both field and broadheads and on both types I have pass through last more often than not at 20 and 30 yards. Needles to mention the number of bolts and broadheads I've lost/destroyed. I don't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Josey R Wales

customer_reviews.title: No quality control
customer_reviews.text: Product was received damaged, with a piece of wood stuck in it and one side of handle broken off. The target itself seems well built but can't believe it was shipped from the factory this way.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it's about what I expected... Great target for the price though
customer_reviews.text: Great target for the price... I have a seventy pound pull on my bow and at twenty yards the arrows only go in 8in or so.... I have noticed some ware in the middle but it's been shot probably 500 times... and 20 or so we're with a rage broadhead... just to make sure my broadheads and field points were on point... I did notice however that my laser range finder can't get a range on the target.. I have to put a board or something next to the target to range it... but yeah it's a good target...
customer_reviews.author: Krebs Family from Colorado

customer_reviews.title: long lasting and stops those arrows
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for over two years on a semi-regular basis. Mostly target points, but shoot a few broadheads before each hunt. easy to carry and has held up to my level of usage.
customer_reviews.author: SamG

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY! USE HAY BAILS!
customer_reviews.text: stops the arrows good but if your a good shot it tears it apart really fast when you hit the same area over and over. i have maybe 75 shots into mine and it wont last much longer cause all the spots have such big holes from removing the arrow. field tips it might work better but for sighting and getting preseason practice with broadheads its no good!! everytime you pull thearrow out with a broadhead it rips out the foam that stops it causing a big hole. i bought this target cause of the good ratings im very dissapointed in this. not worth the money!!! just use hay bails
customer_reviews.author: richard

customer_reviews.title: Better that what I had before...
customer_reviews.text: This target works well - you just plop it down and shoot it. Arrows are slightly easier to remove than pulling them out of a solid foam block. I think it is holding up slightly better too, but it is still starting to soften in the center after about a month of daily practice. Minor point - couldn't they have put 5 targets on the face instead of slapping their logo in target area? Come on, put the advertising on the side and let up shoot. Sure I can sand and repaint, but why should I have too?
customer_reviews.author: P. Smith

customer_reviews.title: arrows go through pretty far and it’s hard to pull them out
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it’s my high powered bow, but arrows go through pretty far and it’s hard to pull them out. Not what I was expecting but at least it was one of the cheaper options.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Target has easy arrow pull, very nice when shooting 50 arrows a day
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: WORKS AS IT SHOULD
customer_reviews.text: 18" target with a new Mathews bow at 70 lbs. No over-penetration.
customer_reviews.author: LISA CHAMBERS

customer_reviews.title: Great Crossbow target!
customer_reviews.text: I first purchased a crossbow kit from Amazon, (check out my review)then needing a target to shoot, I bought this. This product is just what you need to stop a 14" crossbow bolt. It stops them with 2" of shaft sticking out before the fletching enters the target. I also purchased an arrow puller which saves the fingers when retrieving the bolt.. Great products!!
customer_reviews.author: Psycprof

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Paid $99 with shipping for the 22" target. I have a Hoyt Carbon Defiant Turbo set at 60# and my arrows at 20 yards go in maybe a 1/3 of the way with field tips! At 70# it will stop it halfway and to me that's very impressive. Very sturdy product and it will last me a long time. Will buy the same target again!
customer_reviews.author: James M.

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight but durable and my fiance says it is the ...
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight but durable and my fiance says it is the easiest target to get arrows out of that he's ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: CHUNKS CAME OUT FROM THE FIRST TIME USING IT.
customer_reviews.text: I BOUGHT THIS TARGET TO SIGHT IN MY BROADHEADS. AFTER HAVING SHOT 6-10 ARROWS AND REMOVING THEM, PIECES OF THE FOAM CAME OUT. NOW THERE'S PARTS OF THE TARGET WITH CHUNKS OF FOAM MISSING....FROM THE FIRST TIME USING IT...AS IT WAS INTENDED TO BE USED.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: As a new archer this is the only target I've ...
customer_reviews.text: As a new archer this is the only target I've ever used but it appears well made and after around 200 or so shots it doesn't have any issues. Should keep going for many more. It will most-likely take you two hands to remove the arrows but once you get them moving slightly they get much easier to remove the rest of the way.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Careful with the Handle
customer_reviews.text: I moved this target 2 times before the handle ripped out and gashed my hand open. They use barbed nails to hold it in, the barbs pull out of the block and through my hand.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: This is the better than any target bag I've used
customer_reviews.text: This is the better than any target bag I've used. Arrows are easier to smoothly pull out. With a bag you have to pull harder when you get to the field tip. Once you start pulling an arrow out of this target it's a continuous motion. More importantly, despite it weighing much less than any target bag I've used, I can already tell it's more durable. Plus it's cheaper and made in America! What's not to like?
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Washburn

customer_reviews.title: Does the Trick
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a Christmas gift for my boyfriend. He loves it. His only critique is that there aren't dots spray painted on the back. Is this for a certain reason? Also he recommends keeping it in the garage or under a porch to keep out of the elements as his last target took a beating from the weather, which affected its longevity.
customer_reviews.author: alyxsheerheart

customer_reviews.title: Classic target
customer_reviews.text: Great for the back yard, back of the truck, base camp, and it wont break the bank!
customer_reviews.author: kody johnson

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Lightweight and fits in small car easily.
customer_reviews.text: Smallish and light....works great for my 63 pound compound bow. I've put maybe 500 arrows into it so far. Arrows with field points pull out great. I havent tried it with broadheads yet. Fits in the back seat or trunk of a small car just fine. My only concern is that the plastic wrap holding this together may break apart from those arrows that enter in at shallow angles and cut through the plastic. Will keep you posted.
customer_reviews.author: apb

customer_reviews.title: Always good
customer_reviews.text: Nails holding handle gave up quick, easy fix. These have always been good targets. Arrows dont slide out but its 10x easier than most targets, especially animal style targets. Unless you're shooting light poundage bows or youth bows, this is the target you want that will last. Dont leave them in the elements though.
customer_reviews.author: Grant Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Nice solid quality target
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice quality target. It is solid and will take a serious beating. After putting about 50 arrows in this thing you couldn't even tell it had been shot. My arrows are not sinking in too deep with field points and are easily extracted. I plan on using paper targets on this thing for higher visibility, using it as a backstop. I like it and it will get a lot of use here.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Damaged item.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived damaged. Not happy that for the price that it came beaten up already.
customer_reviews.author: J. Krueger

customer_reviews.title: Great target for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: After about 500 shots, it's starting to show. nothing too bad but you can see where the other arrows landed. Still a great product (even though it looks a little cheap) and gets the job done right. I read reviews where it was leaving residue on the arrows, but I haven't noticed. I usually shoot about 10-20 arrows (depending on how good i'm shooting that particular day) from 10-15 yards, from a 30lb pvc bow. They go in roughly 4-6 inches, and pull out very easily.
customer_reviews.author: wojciech ciula

customer_reviews.title: Easy to pull arrow from target as well
customer_reviews.text: Stops arrows from my 70lb bow with no problems. Easy to pull arrow from target as well. will most likely buy another soon.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good target
customer_reviews.text: Catches the arrows well. Nice large target 22” model. Light for the size, so it’s not cumbersome to carry. The material is kind of like yoga mat, held together mechanically with plastic bindings
customer_reviews.author: CHRISTINE M. PRIETO

customer_reviews.title: Over 500 shots into it and it is still looking like new. Not the easiest thing to get arrows ...
customer_reviews.text: Durable well built target, goes everywhere with me when I am shooting. Over 500 shots into it and it is still looking like new. Not the easiest thing to get arrows out so use of an arrow puller helps but I use one anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: possibly the best thing since sliced bread
customer_reviews.text: This thing is genius! I now can practice my shot in the backyard with all the confidence in the world. It's quite robust (has stopped about 2000 arrows in the past 2 months and it's just a little worn out in the middle), removing the shot arrows is very easy and makes a well-pleasing "thump" sound when the arrow hits it.
customer_reviews.author: Serban

customer_reviews.title: Great Target
customer_reviews.text: Although a little pricey, this is a great archery target. I have shot the target hundreds upon hundreds of times. With field tips you could probably shoot this thing 5,000 times before you ever noticed any issues. Broadheads do quite a bit more damage to the target and should be practiced with sparingly. The ONLY downfall that i have found, is the strap on the top is very weak and broke within about 5 days of use. Now the target must be carried in your arms instead of by the strap.
customer_reviews.author: Garret B

customer_reviews.title: Not really for high FPS crossbows.
customer_reviews.text: Seems like it's going to hold up pretty good, but even at 40 yards, the 18" Excalibur Diablo bolts shot out of my Matrix 380 go in all the way to the vanes and are hard to remove. I have not shot any broadheads at it as I'm afraid I wouldn't get them out without tearing chunks out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Weekes

customer_reviews.title: Nice Block Target Stops Arrows
customer_reviews.text: Decently priced target block purchased to use with my Barnett Jackal. Stops broadheads and field points at 10, 20, and 30 yards just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it's meant to do
customer_reviews.text: All of my bows and crossbows are at 70-115 lbs draw, and this thing has stopped every single arrow and bolt I've thrown at it without eating the fletchings. Recovering the shafts is pretty difficult - don't forget to pick up a simple arrow puller with this type of target.
customer_reviews.author: JJM1979

customer_reviews.title: Great target for great price!
customer_reviews.text: Great target! I have a 65 lb draw on my bow and this target takes the arrows like a champ. This only minor issue is that the arrows can be a little hard to remove, but that's really not a bad problem to have. The black background makes my arrows extremely easy to see as opposed to a lighter background target. I'd easily buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Solid target.
customer_reviews.text: I have shot hundreds of arrows into this target and it is holding up great. I have shot arrows that have gone thru the side and ripped the outer plastic and its still holding together. I have no problem pulling the arrows out of the target.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great arrow catcher
customer_reviews.text: My husband has been using this for the last few weeks and so far he is very happy with it. Arrows enter nicely and are easily taken out. Very good price, especially compared to these types of arrow catchers at specialty hunting stores. My father-in-law has almost the same one and it has held up very well with regular use.
customer_reviews.author: Teather

customer_reviews.title: Always good
customer_reviews.text: It's Block Black, don't really need to say more. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: BowHunter60

customer_reviews.title: This target the block is awesome! I purchased a new Dimond bow this spring ...
customer_reviews.text: This target the block is awesome! I purchased a new Dimond bow this spring and a cheap target and was ruining to many carbon arrows that I care to so I still wanted a lower priced target in let me tell you that the block is the sh*t it stops the arrows half way and removal is even better if would recommend this target to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: charles gower

customer_reviews.title: Great targets
customer_reviews.text: It gets 5 stars because it is what was described! If stored inside when not in use it should last 5 seasons or so for the true Avid Archer! I only use this one like it's identical predecessor of 5 yrs old for initial tuning of broadheads then to make sure I'm still sighted in before the actual hunts! No need to punch a lot of razors through it if they are tuned to fly like your field tips!
customer_reviews.author: Ballistica50

customer_reviews.title: MUST BUY!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: WHAT A BUY! Saved money buying on here vrs local shop! I've already put hundreds of arrows in this and you can hardly tell a thing! I don't think I'll ever need a new target the rest of my life!
customer_reviews.author: RWF32

customer_reviews.title: Hands down, the BEST target we have ever had!
customer_reviews.text: This is the BEST target for field points. Arrows are super easy to remove. It does deteriorate over time but is a pleasure to use. We had the 'other' foam Block and it did not hold up well at all and was a bear to pull the arrows. Could not be happier with the Block Classic and have ordered a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Di R

customer_reviews.title: Good target block!
customer_reviews.text: This archery block is the perfect size for practicing at any range. I would purchase this block again without any hesitation. The only negative thing about the block is that the back side does not have any pre-painted circles to aim at. I ended up spray painting 9 of my own circles on the back which actually worked out really out. I am shooting a 55 lb Mathews with only practice tips so far and it is holding up nicely. The arrows only go in maybe a 1/3 of the way. I am enjoying this product and recommend for anyone else. I will try broad heads in it somewhat soon.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon Clair

customer_reviews.title: Well with the money!
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I didn’t like of this target box was that the handle broke off in two days. But it was an easy fix with a longer nail and some glue. “ works great now” otherwise this target is very good for Archery.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Has put up with about twenty to thirty shots every other day for about six months now (weather permitting) from 60lb compound bow. For the money, I'm happy. PS: Have not used a lot of board heads on it, maybe thirty to forty all together
customer_reviews.author: Seafood

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy
customer_reviews.text: Does not stop arrows like the description says. I shoot a crossbow at 405 fps, arrows go almost all the way thru the block. No way to pull them out the front, had to pull them thru the back. Now fletchings are messed up on my arrows. Not pleased at all.
customer_reviews.author: Adam D.

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool for practicing!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! I'm only an amateur and shoot for fun, but this block works great! The smaller area makes for good practice when you're practicing distance shooting. The block also does a great job of holding arrows and you don't have to worry too much about losing tips or something like the haystacks I have behind it protecting my wall.
customer_reviews.author: rvalenz

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, reliable, target.
customer_reviews.text: The Block really does last for a while, and barely gets damaged by the impact/exit holes. It even stops bolts launched from my +350 FPS crossbow with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: This target is a MUST for any practicing archer. ...
customer_reviews.text: This target is a MUST for any practicing archer. Our son is on a Junior Olympic team and is always practicing, the "other" targets just haven't held up very long. This one is extremely durable and don't expect to be replacing it too soon:)
customer_reviews.author: Nicholette

customer_reviews.title: I have bad hands little grip witch makes it hard for me ...
customer_reviews.text: I have bad hands little grip witch makes it hard for me to pull arrows out even after oiling the tips of field point. Younger hand s should not have a problem pulling arrows out.
customer_reviews.author: DBooseAmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this time for a gift. It arrived ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this time for a gift. It arrived on time and was a lot bigger that i had expected. I followed up with the person I purchased this for and I was informed that this item works well.
customer_reviews.author: JSIMA

customer_reviews.title: Great for shooting at home
customer_reviews.text: This is great! Now I don't have to MacGyver some sort of target. It stops arrows well and is a nice big size. The only downside to this was the handle on top. It caught a couple of arrows when I missed and bent them as it whipped around. Problem solved by ripping off the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Putt

customer_reviews.title: Seemingly an infinite mini arrow pincushion! XD
customer_reviews.text: Been butchering this block for 3 months now with bows ranging from 20# to 65#! Still it is in great shape! They are quite expensive, though! Quality is not questionable and hold up with all the arrows I've punctured it with from a 7 yard distance.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian Reid

customer_reviews.title: Great for field tips
customer_reviews.text: Great target for the money. About 100 arrows into it so far and still looks and works like new. Not a top of the line target but also not as expensive. Haven’t tried broadheads yet but holds up with field tips just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Chad C

customer_reviews.title: Not a crossbow target. Shooting 370 fps buried the ...
customer_reviews.text: Not a crossbow target. Shooting 370 fps buried the 20" bolts past the fletchings everytime from 15 to 50 yards.
customer_reviews.author: Chel

customer_reviews.title: Great target for practice
customer_reviews.text: Great target for practice. It's light enough to carry around but heavy enough that it doesn't get knocked over when arrows make contact. So far I've shot a few hundred arrows into it (field points) and it's still in great condition. I expect this target to last many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Mulder

customer_reviews.title: Crossbow bolts will go into the fletching. Every time ...
customer_reviews.text: Crossbow bolts will go into the fletching. Every time anywhere under 60 yds. With a 360fps crossbow. It will stop them but they go deep.
customer_reviews.author: ben weeks

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Nothing you can't make yourself besides a better handle. The handle ripped out before I could carry it out the door.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Good target, handle came off day 1
customer_reviews.text: Would of given 5 stars but the handle came out when I pulled it out of the box, was a simple repair; but shouldn’t have to fix.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Strebeck

customer_reviews.title: It will stop bolts good but getting them out is a different story
customer_reviews.text: It will stop bolts good but getting them out is a different story . I'll probably use this target for broadheads and get a different type for field points .
customer_reviews.author: fishuntfish

customer_reviews.title: Great value, very durable
customer_reviews.text: Great target for any style of arrow tip. Best value for this style of target that I have found. I will by again when it's worn out, which looks like it will be a long time with field points, if you were using broadheads only and shooting a lot it may wear out faster.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: This product is a fine quality product I shoot at least 50 to 100 ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is a fine quality product I shoot at least 50 to 100 shots every day my dad is holding up great I've had block targets before and I've always been very satisfied with them would recommend them to anyone who likes to shoot they're bow quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Berry

customer_reviews.title: Great target for my compound and recurve bows
customer_reviews.text: Great target. Light weight and portable. Stops my arrows with easy release...
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Bracken

customer_reviews.title: Love that thump
customer_reviews.text: Holds up extremely well to crossbow fire, also makes a very satisfying thump when the arrow lands.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. Plan to give as gift. Mine arrived with a shipping sticker on it and it will not come off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Best quality archery target I have ever used. SUPER durable even with real arrow tips
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Well Priced, Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Works just as great as any other block target! The price might suggest it isn't top quality, but it is. No complaints shooting field tips with a compound at 75 lbs draw weight. I have NOT shot broadheads into this, but there is really no need to ever shoot broadheads into a block- just use field tips with the same weight.
customer_reviews.author: tsparky1589

customer_reviews.title: Best I've tried.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent target, relatively easy arrow removal. Robust design allows for hundreds if not thousands of shots due to arrows slipping in between layers without damaging them.
customer_reviews.author: T.Ware

customer_reviews.title: This thing is rugged so far. My son uses ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is rugged so far. My son uses it with his compound bow and the arrows sink in less than half way. His bow is set just under 40lbs but I am sure the block will take much more.
customer_reviews.author: GC

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: this target in the past has lasted for years of daily shooting during the summer months.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

product_meta.title: Block Classic Archery Target - Stops Arrows with Friction not Force!
product_meta.description: BLOCK CLASSIC ARCHERY TARGET - It is based on the original, legendary BLOCK target and is simply the best 2-sided archery target on the market. Block Classic Archery Targets come in 3 sizes; 18, 20, and 22
feature_bullets: 2-SIDED ARCHERY TARGET - Measures 18" x 18" x 14" – Also available in a 20” and 22” model

EASY ARROW REMOVAL and INCREDIBLE STOPPING POWER - Patented open layer design stops arrows with friction not force allowing for easy arrow removal and less shooter fatigue; also stops all broadheads and field tips
GREAT VISIBILITY - High contrast white-on-black aiming points offer great visibility to help shooters at short and long distances
PORTABLE – With a built-in handle, the BLOCK Classic is easy to transport. It is also light-weight!

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
